alert.note: Alert for Hardin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 11:53AM EST until January 04 at 4:36AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: .The Flash flood threat is diminishing, however plenty of standing water is still present across the area. A flood warning is now in effect. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Bullitt, Hardin, Nelson and Spencer. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1153 AM EST, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Shepherdsville, Radcliff, Mount Washington, Hillview, Vine Grove, Lebanon Junction, West Point, Fairfield and Belmont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
